products.label: IBM Cloudability Enablement
products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-cloudability
products.short_description: Add your IBM Cloud Account to IBM Cloudability and start tracking your cloud spend.
products.long_description:
Simplify your IBM Cloud Account onboarding to IBM Cloudability with this deployable architecture. Only an IBM Cloud IAM Api Key and Cloudability API key are required. This deployable architecture will take care of all of the necessary steps to get your IBM Cloud billing data into IBM Cloudability. This includes the following:

1. Creating Key Protect Encrypted COS Buckets to store your daily billing snapshots.
2. Setup writing of billing snapshots to the COS Bucket.
3. Grant IBM Cloudability access to read from the COS buckets
4. Add your IBM Cloud account to Cloudability and run access verification from Cloudability.

Your IBM Cloud billing data will begin showing up in IBM Cloudability the next day. 
To obtain your IBM Cloudability API key visit https://app.apptio.com/cloudability#/settings/preferences under the section **Cloudability API** select **Enable API** which will generate an api key. If you don't have a Cloudability account start your tree trial now: https://www.apptio.com/products/cloudability/#cldy-trial.

features.title: Daily exports of your cloud billing reports to a COS Bucket
features.description: Cloudability reads CSV Billing reports which are added to a COS bucket daily for each account in your enterprise.

features.title: Encrypted Bucket with Key Protect
features.description: Daily billing reports are stored in a Key Protect encrypted bucket allowing the automated rotatation of encryption keys. See https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-tutorial-kp-encrypt-bucket.

features.title: Least Privileged Operations to Cloudability
features.description: Custom access roles are created so that cloudability only has the minimal required access to your IBM Cloud Account.

features.title: Cloudability Onboarding Verification
features.description: Verification of the account onboarding to IBM Cloudability is performed so that you have confidence that the configuration is correct.

features.title: Add all accounts in an Enterprise to Cloudability
features.description: Running this deployable architecture at the root (primary) Enterprise Account will cause all existing and future accounts in the enterprise to be added to IBM Cloudability.

features.title: Managed with Code!
features.description: Easily re-configure or clean-up the onboarding of your accounts to Cloudability and ensure that everything is centrally connected and configured.

diagrams.description: Billing exports are written to a Key Protect encrypted COS bucket. IBM Cloudability is granted access to read from this bucket to add ibm cloud billing reports daily. Key Protect and Cloud Object Storage are created in your desired region and resource group. Optionally, configure retention and archiving of the data in your bucket and enable monitoring and auditing to your cloud object storage bucket.

configuration.description: The IBM Cloud API Key

Cloudability API Key. Retrieve your Api Key from https://app.apptio.com/cloudability#/settings/preferences under the section **Cloudability API** select **Enable API** which will generate an api key. Setting this value to __NULL__ will skip adding the IBM Cloud account to Cloudability and only configure IBM Cloud so that the IBM Cloud Account can be added to Cloudability manually.
The cloudability hostname as documented in https://help.apptio.com/en-us/cloudability/api/v3/getting_started_with_the_cloudability.htm#authentication

whether to verify that the IBM Cloud account has been configured correctly in cloudability. Requires cloudability_api_key to be set. Verification is not strictly necessary but helps ensure that everything was setup correctly.
Region where resources will be created. Only us-south, eu-de and jp-tok have [Key protect failover support](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/key-protect?topic=key-protect-ha-dr#availability)

Whether the account is a root enterprise account. Adds an additional grant for cloudability to query the list of accounts in an enterprise. If enabled will fetch the enterprise account id to complete onboarding.

Use this field in the case when the provided `ibmcloud_api_key` does not have access to view the enterprise. Setting this value to `__NULL__` will along with `is_enterprise_account` is true will cause the `enterprise_id` to be automatically retrieved.
Whether `resource_group_name` input represents the name of an existing resource group or a new resource group should be created
The name of a new or existing resource group where resources will be created

The CRN of an Activity Tracker instance to send Object Storage bucket events to. If no value passed, events are sent to the instance associated to the container's location unless otherwise specified in the Activity Tracker Event Routing service configuration.
If set to true, all Object Storage bucket read events (i.e. downloads) will be sent to Activity Tracker.
If set to true, all Object Storage bucket write events (i.e. uploads) will be sent to Activity Tracker.
If set to true, all Object Storage management events will be sent to Activity Tracker. Only applies if `activity_tracker_crn` is not populated.

The CRN of an IBM Cloud Monitoring instance to to send Object Storage bucket metrics to. If no value passed, metrics are sent to the instance associated to the container's location unless otherwise specified in the Metrics Router service configuration.
If set to `true`, all Object Storage bucket request metrics will be sent to the monitoring service.
If set to `true`, all Object Storage bucket usage metrics will be sent to the monitoring service.
Optional list of tags to be added to created resources
Optional list of access tags to be added to the created resources

The Guid of the Key Protect or Hyper Protect instance in which the key specified in var.kms_key_crn is coming from. Required if var.skip_iam_authorization_policy is false in order to create an IAM Access Policy to allow Key Protect or Hyper Protect to access the newly created COS instance.
Name of the Key Protect instance name used for bucket encryption
Name of the key ring to group keys
Name of the cos bucket encryption key
The ID of an existing cloud object storage instance. Required if 'var.create_cos_instance' is false.

Name of the cloud object storage (COS) bucket where billing reports are stored
Add random generated suffix (4 characters long) to the newly provisioned COS bucket name. This helps avoid naming conflicts since bucket names need to be globally unique
Folder in the COS bucket to store the billing reports
Plan to be used for creating cloud object storage instance.
The storage class of the newly provisioned COS bucket of a `standard` or `lite` plan instance. Not required for one rate instances.
Enable object versioning to keep multiple versions of an object in a bucket.
Specifies the number of days when the archive rule action takes effect.
Specifies the storage class or archive type to which you want the object to transition.
Specifies the number of days when the expire rule action takes effect.

Whether access to the cos bucket is controlled at the bucket (resource), cos instance (serviceInstance), or resource-group (resourceGroup). This property may be useful in the complex scenario of aggregating billing exports across many IBM Cloud enterprises or accounts into a central instance
name of the custom role which grants cloudability access to read from the billing reports cos bucket
name of the custom role which grants cloudability to read the enterprise information.
